programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.desc: The Wildcats challenge the No. 4 Cougars in a Big 12 matchup. Houston's three-game winning streak includes a pair of victories over ranked schools. The programs last met in December 1974, when Kansas State scored a one-point decision in Texas.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Seminoles stand up to the sizzling No. 3 Tar Heels. North Carolina carries a nine-game win streak and a perfect 8-0 ACC record into this tilt. Florida State has won six of its past seven. UNC's RJ Davis is averaging 21 points per game in 2023-24.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 12 Duke tries to avoid consecutive home losses when Clemson visits. Duke has won nine of its past 10 despite a rare home blemish Jan. 20 against Pittsburgh. Clemson's PJ Hall is averaging 23.3 points and 11.3 rebounds over his last three outings.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 6 Wildcats (14-4, 4-2 SEC) try to end a two-game slide away from home as they visit the Razorbacks (10-9, 1-5). Kentucky halted a three-game Arkansas run in the head-to-head series by taking an 88-79 decision in the second meeting of 2022-23.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Crimson Tide (13-6, 5-1 SEC) roll into an engagement with the Tigers (11-8, 3-3). Alabama has won seven of its last eight after earning a 79-75 upset win over rival No. 8 Auburn on Jan. 24. Bama smoked LSU by 40 points at home in 2022-23.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: Series of documentaries looking back through the history of sports.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston Outdoors
programme.desc: Jimmy and his friend, John Knochel, are fishing at Cross Pines in east Texas with a spinner bait bite; Jimmy has a few tips to better anglers.

programme.title: Scott Martin Challenge
programme.desc: Scott vs. the 2023 Bassmaster Rookie of the Year on Lake Ontario.

programme.title: 2024 Australian Open Tennis
programme.desc: Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka hopes to become the first woman to win consecutive Australian Open titles since 2013 when she faces No. 12 seed Zheng Qinwen in the final. Sabalenka defeated American Coco Gauff in a hard-fought semifinal match.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Gators try to resume their winning ways against the Bulldogs in an SEC affair. Florida has won eight straight meetings. Georgia is 3-1 in true road games. Gators guard Will Richard totaled 38 points in two contests versus the Bulldogs in 2022-23.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Longhorns (14-5, 3-3) surge into their Big 12 game against the No. 21 Cougars (14-5, 2-4). Texas comes off victories over then-No. 9 Baylor and at No. 11 Oklahoma. BYU has dropped two in a row, at then-No. 25 Texas Tech and to No. 4 Houston.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 15 Bears try to lock in when they host the Horned Frogs. Baylor comes off close losses at Kansas State and Texas. In 2022-23, the programs split the first two meetings in which both longtime Texas rivals ranked inside the AP Top 25.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Dukes seek revenge against the Mountaineers in a collision of top Sun Belt teams. James Madison has won three straight since a 59-55 loss to Appalachian State. Justin Abson (APP) collected 12 points, eight rebounds and four blocks in that game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Struggling Tinseltown foes take the floor as the Trojans play a game against the Bruins. The storied Los Angeles institutions share less-than-stellar 8-11 records this season. Boogie Ellis (USC) totaled 41 points in two games versus UCLA in 2022-23.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Utes seek a season sweep of the Pac-12 foe Huskies. Utah has won two straight meetings after a 95-90 decision in December that featured Branden Carlson's 34 points, seven rebounds and seven assists, and guard Gabe Madsen's double-double.

programme.title: College Basketball Live
programme.desc: A rotating roster of college basketball hosts and analysts discuss the latest headlines, top players and upcoming matchups.

programme.title: NFL's Greatest Games
programme.desc: The San Francisco 49ers defeat the Dallas Cowboys to earn a Super Bowl berth.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The revenge-hopeful Heat head for the Big Apple to play a matinee against the Knicks. New York won the first meeting this season, erasing a 21-point deficit to prevail 100-98 in an In-Season Tournament affair behind Jalen Brunson's 24 points.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Lakers head north up the Golden State to renew their rivalry with the Warriors. In May 2023, Los Angeles needed six games to move past Golden State in the second round of the Western Conference playoffs. The Lakers are 6-15 as the visitor.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: For the second time in as many weeks, Joel Embiid and the 76ers play Nikola Jokic and the Nuggets. Embiid, the reigning MVP, outplayed the man who took home the award in 2021 and 2022 with a 41-point double-double in a 126-121 triumph Jan. 16.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.
